channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: New public realm works on old Shaftesbury Ave, 26th August
item.description:
There is a blue sign on a post here showing mixed use cycle/pedestrian. However, to the best of my knowledge, there is NO mixed use area here - there is a "segregated" cycleway marked with a circle cycle marker in the ground, and a pedestrian footway either side.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Central Street, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Dead parrot on pavement, 26th August
item.description:
Dead parrot (it's a bright green bird) on pavement in front of 80 Bromley rd, Peking takeaway, opposite bus stop. My poor mum found it on the road. Has been there for an hour. Please can it be picked up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Bromley Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Repeated fly-tipping, 26th August
item.description:
There is repeated fly-tipping happening on the pavement in front of 28 Powell Road (Lark House). Unclear if this is residents of block or not. Peabody have also been notified of the problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powell Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Litter bin overflowing, 26th August
item.description:
At 11am this morning the litter bin at the entrance to the underpass leading to the woods was completely full. Why wasn't this emptied over the weekend? Needs urgent attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazelmere Road, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grafitti sprayed on to Sewell Road east of junction with Grovebury Road, 26th August
item.description:
Hello, I noticed the Grafitti sprayed actually onto Sewell Road itself which I understand is maintained by Greenwich Council. Can this grafitti please be removed as its quite threatening? I'm sorry that I don't actually know the postcode of this exact spot. However the grafitti is on Sewell road about 100 years east of the junction of Grovebury Road. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sewell Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass over road and pavement, 26th August
item.description:
There is glass all over the road and pavement at junction between park road and chislehurst high street which means cars can’t drive on that area safely and people and pets cannot walk on that area safely. Please can you clean this up urgently thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, High Street, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Urinating on staircases health safety issue, 26th August
item.description:
Neighbours are urinating in the staircases and lift is not always working it forces us neighbours to step on urine. Unpleasant smell. And faeces on the stairs. This is unacceptable and ongoing issue that hasn’t been sorted out. I almost slipped. Sort itout

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
